answers.answer: That dr. Is a jerk!!! Fat or skinny anyone can get gestational diabetes. I'm over weight and I did not have gestational diabetes. As for eating right my fitness pal is a great tool to keep track of what your consuming it has helped me loss a lot of weight. I like to eat so I pick things I can eat a lot of like grapes. I can eat 4 cups of grapes to one candy bar. Good luck. And ignore that jerk of a doctor

I was on a diet to before pregnancy and I am 23 w gained 25lb. My doctor hasn't said anything though. But it's hard to control your eating when uve tracked so long. I have been freaking out too. But I've talked to a whole bunch of skinny ladies who I know who lost it easy and they gained like 70lbs so I wouldn't worry to much I'm not

Im 30 weeks ive gained about 34 lbs. I feel great, maybe a little heavy but I don't let it concern me. My doctors haven't said I should be more careful.  I believe we're entitled to a little indulgence just do your best to make up with healthy snacks/meals and exercise :)
Im 31 weeks today exact and only gain 16lbs throughout my pregnancy...i don't think u should worry much if ur on a good diet n exercise ull be ok..

i think that's terrible of a dr to make you feel bad. this is a sensitive time for every mom, your bodies changing and alot of it is and feels completely out of your control. the weight gain guidelines are just that guidelines how can the expect ever single women who is pregnant to gain exactly the same amount of weight.  everyone carries different and puts on weight differently. i dont think its fair to put so much stress on a pregnant women who already has so much on her mind. ignore the dr. if your feeling good and babies healthy. dont worry,  eat well when you can and indulge sometimes. ive recently been diagnosed with gestesinal diabetes and had zero risk factors have put on about 22 lbs in 30 weeks so i dont think the amount you have gain puts you at anymore risk. its just one of those things either your body copes with the extra stress on your insulin production or it doesn't,again out of your control body has a mind of its own.

I also use my fitness pal.. i just look at the calories but there is a chart that shows you how much of everything you've consumed. It dont know how to eat either so i completely understand you. Its frustrating when you think you are not doing anything different.  Dont get down on yourself. You have a beautiful baby on the way!

Wow. This forum is great I didn't expect so much feedback.  Thank u all and I feel better I think I will just cut back on my indulgences from this point forward and see what happens.  Thanks again and happy thanksgiving
I'm 29wks and have gained 35 pounds already. I don't think you have anything to worry about. My dr didn't say anything about my weight, except "looks good".
I'm 30 weeks and have almost gained 40 pounds. I was underweight when I got pregnant though but I still don't look like I've gained weight except in my belly

Some doctors are jerks. My first pregnancy I gained 70 lbs but no gd. The doctors would ask what I'd be eating and I'd tell them I like my sweets but try to balance it out with lots of salads or lean proteins. But they'd always have something to say about the healthy stuff I was eating (my favorite was "try eating some real vegetables" in reference to mushrooms in my salad).It all varies, as long as you feel healthy and you're not like I was (giving in to all the sweets, every day),you'll be fine. GD can happen  to anyone, it's about how your body processes the sugars not your weight.

First pregnancy I gained 60lbsSecond pregnancy I gained 17lbs because I was always sickwith my third I gained over 90lbswith this pregnancy I'm trying to watch my weight because I haven't last it all from my last baby..that being said I had gestational diabetes with my first 2 and didn't have it with my 3rd baby which is where I gained the most weight.. what an a-hole doctor ur pregnant as long as ur healthy along with baby eat wat u crave..

I know gow you feel. I don't know how much weight I've gained all together so far (I'm 39 weeks and 2 days) but a few months ago my old doctor told me that i shouldn't have gained any weight at all. I mean i wasn't skinny when i got pregnant, I'm a bigger woman but for him to say that to me pissed me off. Like obviously you gain weight when you're pregnant. At the time i had only gained like 20 pounds and he was making a big deal about it. I understand that he's a doctor and he's worried but you don't have to be a douche about it -_-

question: Hello mommies,I am 26 weeks preggo and have already gained 35 lbs. I have been on a diet for almost 4 years prior to this pregnancy and feel like I don't know how to eat (i know sounds weird). Anyways, I'm enjoying my splurges every now and again but I do not feel at all like I'm eating out of control. Dr on call today pretty much made me feel like a glutton ;-(Has this happened to anyone else? And is this maybe a sign of gestational diabetes?  Took The test today
title: Too much weight gain
